When a Jira instance has a large number of issue, an optimise can cause HTTP threads to time out.  For example, on this instance, there are 190K issue with a 1.9G main index.  When the limit of 4000 issues is reached, the thread that causes that to be reached will kick off an optimised.  This means that the whole 1.9Gb index will be rewritten.  In this case, it took 111 seconds:

{noformat}
2009-09-17 17:17:06,293 http-8000-Processor49 INFO tstcreateissue73 62195x782165x2 1bxkl5q http://localhost:8000/secure/AddComment.jspa [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Optimizing the
 index because 4009 issues have been re-indexed since last optimize. Threshold is 4000.
2009-09-17 17:18:27,154 http-8000-Processor32 INFO tstcreateissue230 62195x782163x8 779gde http://localhost:8000/secure/CreateIssueDetails.jspa [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Optimize index completed in 111623ms.
{noformat}

This led to a timeout for a thread attempting to add a comment:

{noformat}
2009-09-17 17:18:57,865 http-8000-Processor32 ERROR tstcreateissue230 62307x782180x10 779gde http://localhost:8000/secure/AddComment.jspa [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds

fields.description: Currently in support, it is common practice to comment on an bug and link back to a support issue which exposed it. If this comment is set to public, any user viewing the comment may try to click on the link and will not find the support request as it's NOT public. It would be great if Jira could detect and warn about these potential security clashes at the time of comment submittal. I'm aware that this would only work for a single instance, and would also require parsing the URL (altho hopefully Don W's link canonicalising work will handle this), but would be hugely useful.
fields.summary: Autodetect link permission problems

fields.description:
{{JiraSafeActionParameterSetter}} holds a {{Map<Class<? extends Action>, PropertyDescriptor[]>}} to cache the action class's checked parameter lookup. The key in this class is a strong reference, and the class itself is held for the lifetime of the application by WebWork.

The key in this map needs to be a weak reference, not a strong one.
fields.summary: Permgen leak when doing Import All if a Plugins2 Webwork Action plugin is loaded

fields.description:
The JQL history URLs use the executeAdvanced command on the issue navigator. This command does not set the edit mode to "advanced" in the session, which means:

1. Perform a Jql search and copy and paste the url from the history 
2. create a new search and browse to simple edit mode
3. paste the history url into the path bar and load
4. Notice that your on advanced screen but your given the option to switch to the advanced mode and not simple.

Fix:
executeAdvanced should set the edit mode to advanced in the session and cookie.
fields.summary: JQL History Urls show "switch to advanced" when already in advanced.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19108].
  {panel}

This ticket is a follow up of JSP-43756.

Our business case is as follow :
* We are using Confluence as a requirement management tool to keep track of the User Stories
* When an enhancement is requested by a client, it is captured in JIRA
* When this enhancement is approved, we change the code and tie it back to the JIRA ticket using the Subversion Plugin
* We *would like* to change the user story to account for the enhancement, and tie this change to the Confluence page back to the JIRA ticket, in pretty much the same way we are doing in Subversion

We could enter the ticket number in the Confluence change comment, and have a plugin pick that up and link it to the JIRA ticket.

That way, we would have a link from the ticket to the change in the code and the change in the requirement. We would have a link from both the code and  the requirement using the change comment.

Currently I have only see the possiblity of linking the complete Confluence page to the ticket as opposed to a particular changeset of this page.
fields.summary: Provide a way to link a Confluence Changeset to a JIRA ticket

fields.description:
This seems to be a regression as a result of JRA-15876.

The icon URL used to be escaped before being output into the XML view. Now it is not.

This causes the XML view to render incorrectly when the URL has certain characters in it e.g. ampersand. It was observed that if viewing the Search Request results as an XML view, the result source would be complete, however the view of that source in Firefox would be truncated (or not present at all).

It can also affect the JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence as the macro will be unable to parse the XML, e.g.

{noformat}
2009-09-14 13:56:30,058 WARN [http-8080-4] [confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesServlet] doGet An IO Exception has been encountered: Error on line 188: The reference to entity "modificationDate" must end with the ';' delimiter.
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/issue-retriever | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8080/display/ds/list
java.io.IOException: Error on line 188: The reference to entity "modificationDate" must end with the ';' delimiter.
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.DefaultJiraIssuesManager.getChannelElement(DefaultJiraIssuesManager.java:163)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.DefaultJiraIssuesManager.retrieveXML(DefaultJiraIssuesManager.java:192)

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 9 January 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We're pleased to announce that this suggestion was implemented in JIRA Server 7.3.

We'll keep you informed, once we decide to release this improvement to JIRA Cloud.

Please don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions or feedback.

Regards,
 Dave Meyer (Cloud)
 Eve Stankiewicz (Server)
 JIRA Product Managers
{panel}
If you create a workflow with a few steps, but don't add any transitions to them, no transitions can be added and the steps cannot be deleted once the workflow scheme is associated to a project, even if you make a draft workflow.

As soon as you disassociate all projects from the workflow scheme, you can add transitions or delete the step.

How to reproduce:

1. Create a workflow.
 2. Create multiple steps in the workflow but add no transitions.
 3. Create a workflow scheme.
 4. Associate the workflow to an issue type in the workflow scheme.
 5. Associate the workflow scheme to a project.
 6. Create a draft of the workflow.
 7. Try to add a transition to any of the steps.
 8. Try to delete any of the steps.

This is not a support request, as I have a workaround: make sure every step has at least one transition before associating them to a project.
fields.summary: Allow to add transitions to a step on an active workflow even if it has no outgoing transitions when there are no issues in that step

fields.description: A bug description should be short.  We get long descriptions because people paste entire email threads into the description when they create an issue.  If the comment field were available at the time of creation, they could type a short description, then paste their thread in the comment field, where it belongs.  This seems like "low hanging fruit," and easy request to enhance the product.
fields.summary: Include "comment" field when creating a new issue.

fields.description:
See the discussion at: http://www.nabble.com/Jira-SOAP-interface-and-remotely-updating-custom-fields-td22421561.html

Remote API (SOAP or rest) needs to be able to update all fields associated with an issue independent of screen configuration. There are many use cases for automation being able to do things that are not possible to end users.

A specific case is having a field that is replicated from an external system and any edits that would be done by users would be overridden on the next update from the external system.
fields.summary: Remote API support for changing fields not on edit screen

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19083].

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 12 November 2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.

We're happy to announce that this new feature is resolved in JIRA 5.2, satisfying 171 votes!

The Filter Results Gadget in JIRA 5.2 now supports ordering of fields. The ability to order columns has also been added to the Assigned to Me, Voted Issues, Watched Issues and In Progress Issues gadgets.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,

Bryan
JIRA Product Management
brollins at atlassian dot com

{panel}

*Original description*
"Filter Results" gadget is a very nice gadget and it allows one to select the fields to display, however there is no option to control the field order.
fields.summary: Allow ordering of fields in gadgets

fields.summary: Time since gadget doesn't show in full size if configured using project/filter list in Safari 4

fields.description:
Up until JIRA 3.10, the Mantis importer appeared to able to import into an existing project.  What it actually did was create a new project with the same key as the existing project (which shouldn't be possible) and import the issues into that project.

This was discovered and fixed in 3.10 (JRA-12827), but the 'fix' was to simply disallow importing into existing projects.  Currently you'll get an error if you try:

!mantisimporter.png!

Being able to import into an existing project is fairly essential, especially since, because of JRA-8248, one cannot bulk move projects around without losing versions/components.
fields.summary: Allow Mantis importer to import into existing project

fields.description:
When the user first logs in after a server reset and clicks a filter in his favourite filters gadget, they are taken to the issue navigator with no fitler in session and are just shown the "create new" link.

If the user then creates a new filter, goes back to the dash board and tries to load the filter again, it works.

It seems the the "requestId" url parameter isn't working as expected when there isn't already a request in session.
fields.summary: Favourite filters gadget does not load filter if there isnt already one in session

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. From "Manage Filter" dialog open any already saved filter.
3. Click View_Charts and click "Save to Dashboard"

Result:
1. Beside selecting dashboard option, user has option to save that filter.
2. We never used to show the filter save dialog when user create charts with already save filter.

Expected:
1. Only Dashboard selection drop down should be there.
fields.summary: Opening charts dialog with already saved filter is showing create filter option.

fields.description:
Often I want to refresh my dashboard, (in order to refresh the lists of Issues in my Gadgets).

Now, I automatically want to click on the Dashboard tab again, but there are only links on the inactive tabs.

Add to this the fact that clicking the browser refresh button takes 10 seconds to load the page, whereas the tab links take 5 seconds (browser refresh does a lot of checking for updates on resources, it seems to get "304 Not modified" most the time, but this still adds up).
fields.summary: Let the active tab on the Dashboard have a link that will "refresh" the current Dashboard.

fields.description: Legacy portlets are displayed in the add gadget browser. We should probably hide them if we have replacement gadgets available.
fields.summary: hide legacy portlets from gadget browser

fields.description:
From Rich:
{quote}
The atl.popup decorator is pretty sparse.  I was logging in and
approving tokens as different users and never knew which user I was
logged in as and approving the token for.  Probably adding the users
name to the upper right similar to the regular JIRA pages would be
good enough.  It doesn't even have to be a menu or anything, just
something so users can tell who they're logged in as.
{quote}
fields.summary: The popup decorator in JIRA is too sparse

fields.description:
Hi Team

We need to enable captcha on our corporate jira applications , We do have option to enable captcha in jira , but that only work in case of signing up new user .

We want to enable captcha when login attempts are made to our application 5-6 times .

Please let us know the way to do it

Regards
Vikas
fields.summary: We want to enable captcha when login attempts are made to our application 5-6 times

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19057].
  {panel}

For some issues, our team captures screencasts for reproducing an issue.  There are many tools out there for this, but we happen to use Wink - http://www.debugmode.com/wink/   .  This greatly simplifies the reproduction steps for certain issues, as instead of spending lots of time describing the issue, you can simply record your clicks, export it as a SWF, and then pass that along as the reproduction steps.

We can attach the flash files to an existing issue with no problem, however, they are not easy to view within jira, as they're treated like any other file attachment instead of being treated like an image where they can just be viewed from within jira.

Similar to CONF-991 which was implemented in Confluence 1.5, we'd like to have the ability to attach flash movies just like images and have Jira be able to play them on screen (or potentially via a new popup/div like the confluence gallery plugin).  This way, someone can view the reproduction of an issue from directly inside jira instead of having to download 1-3 files (sometimes a wrapper HTML and JS file are needed, both about 2 lines each, just so the browser activates the movie) into the same directory and launch locally.

Theoretically, this could apply to Quicktime MOV's or other common file types that can be <EMBED>'d within the browser, but Flash is the primary concern here.
fields.summary: Add "Attach Flash" or "Attach Movie" similar to "Attach Screenshot"

fields.description:
The POP/IMAP fetcher service does not validate the value of the PORT when the user enters it. This allows them to enter in invalid values like -20, 3482048823894283. We should validate the entered value.

Implementing this is harder than it seems because services use object configurable for their configuration screens. At the moment JIRA does not provide any way for services to have their properties validated.
fields.summary: The POP/IMAP fetcher service does not validate the value of the PORT when the user enters it.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. Add any gadget on dashboard where user needs to select project/filter.
3. Press spac to view the list of available options.

Result:
1. In IE as there is no scroll bar, the focus shift to inbetween of data when it open.
2. Scrolling is also difficult.

Expected:
1. Scroll bar can make things better.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Add a gadget supporting canvas view on dashboard.
3. Before configuring the gadget go to canvas view. Now choose filter/project and configure.
4. Restore the gadget to normal view.

Result:
1. Gadget preferences got reset and user has preferences dialog to again set.
2. Now If user set and save the preferences, it will get reset again when user goes to canvas view.

Expected:
1. preferences should be retain once set.
fields.summary: Gadget preferences configured in canvas view are not retain when user restore the gadget to normal view in IE

fields.description:
This is because the {{com.atlassian.jira.plugin.renderercomponent.SimpleRendererComponentFactory}} tries to load the actual component using Pico ({{(RendererComponent) JiraUtils.loadComponent(rendererComponentClass)}}).

An example of such a descriptor I have that fails in AppLinks:
{code:xml}
    <renderer-component-factory key="applinks.crucible.review"
                                name="Applinks Crucible Review Link Renderer Component Factory"
                                class="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.renderercomponent.SimpleRendererComponentFactory">
        <order>209</order>
        <param name="rendererComponentClass">
            com.atlassian.applinks.core.renderer.crucible.CrucibleReviewLinkRendererComponent
        </param>
        <resource type="velocity" name="help" location="templates/applinks/cruciblereviewlinkrendererhelp.vm">
            <param name="help-section">links</param>
        </resource>
        <resource type="i18n" name="i18n" location="templates.applinks.cruciblereviewlinkrendererhelp"/>
    </renderer-component-factory>
{code}
fields.summary: Cannot use renderer-component-factory module descriptors in JIRA 4

fields.description:
Go to an issue, and click on EDIT to add a label.

The 'Add Labels' dialog opens, but then you are required to click inside the text box to start typing. This is annoying.

In JIRA 3.13 (and Confluence), you can open the 'Add Labels' dialog and then immediately start typing.
fields.summary: Need to click inside text field when adding labels to an issue

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Add "Time Since Chart" gadget on dashboard.
3. Configure it with previous day options as 500.
4. Click save to view the gadget.

Result:
1. The gadget view says it showing data for last 500 days but if you click on issues link, the query has -300d day define and that is thelimit.
2. If user search less then 300d everything will be fine but more then 300....no luck.
3. Its working in 3.13.5

Expected:
1. User should see correct result.
fields.summary: Chart gadgets don't display warning if user is trying to view more data than allowed for a certain period

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Goto Simple nav and search for some project.
3. Click "Advanced" link or you can save the filter and then click on advanced.

Result:
1. User see project key in place of project name in advance view.
2. If user create a project in advance view and use auto complete, on selecting project from list, we show project name. User can save it as filter and it get retain.
3. Hence it look a bit inconsistent between simple nav and advanced. Plus it always not easy to know the name of project by seeing its key.

Expected:
1. user sees project name and not key when moving from simple nav to advance.
fields.summary: From usability point of view it will be great if we show project name(in advanced view) for queries created or saved in simple navigator

fields.description:
On my home dashboard I have a portlet of all my votes and watches. Until the recent upgrade it showed all issues. Now it has a max of 50 (!!!!). That just won't do. I typically use this page and search using the browser search key because searching via JIRA is slower and less helpful.

Please remove or drastically increase this arbitrary limit !
fields.summary: Allow to configure the limit of 50 issues for my Watches or Votes portlet

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA and add project gadget on dashboard.
2. The project has some projects and 1 category defined.
3. By default the focus is on Projects.
4. Select Categories radio button.

Result:
1. Nothing happens. Now if user click "Projects", it display categories information in window and vice versa.

Expected:
1. The radio button selection should show correct relevant information.
fields.summary: Moving between project and category for project gadget is not working fine in IE

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA and add project gadget to your dashboard.
2. Click on Report/Filter drop down.

Result
1. The whole gadget UI shifts. More details in snapshot.
2. versions option is not visible by default, till user set focus there.
3. Opening report drop down after opening filter only displays summary.


Expected:
1. As both the icons are new, tooltip will be really helpful.
2. Moving between the options should be smooth as in FF
fields.summary: Issues with project gadget "Report" and "Filter" drop down in IE

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to gadget.
2. Add any gadget where user need to select project/filter to configure it.
3. Press space to view all options for project/filter.
4. Try to scroll down by clicking the down arrow button in FF

Result:
1. The drop down closes

Expected:
1. It should take user to next set of data down in list
fields.summary: Clicking on up and drop arrow buttons in gadget preferences for filter/project drop down closes it in FF

fields.description:
A user will be unable to install JIRA 4.0 under any directory that already has 61 characters in it.

The file {{AbstractSingleValueCustomFieldSearchInputTransformer$NavigatorConversionResult.class}} in {{atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.0-SNAPSHOT-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/issue/customfields/searchers/transformer/}} creates a path that is too long for NTFS when there are already 61 characters in the path, see [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365247(VS.85).aspx].

!http://img.skitch.com/20090909-ctcs694yecgkndxhju2fbn3d9n.jpg!
fields.summary: Document AbstractSingleValueCustomFieldSearchInputTransformer$NavigatorConversionResult.class and parent directories causes 'name too long' for Win32 NTFS workaround in CAC

fields.description:
When clicking on links in Jira issues, especially custom fields or links in comments that are URL's external to the Jira server, the link should open in a new tab.

For example, I often find that when linking to documents in our document storage system, that it is distracting to have to "back" button to return to my Jira issue after checking the documentation.

I have begun receiving requests to this effect from the users in my company.  Is there any chance that this is a planned change in the next version?
fields.summary: Links should open in new tabs
